Title.evidence: This retrospective study employs a propensity score-matching (PSM) design

Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective study employs a propensity score-matching (PSM) design

Intervention.evidence: evaluate the analgesic efficacy of TAP block and ITH in upper-abdominal surgeries

Objective.evidence: to evaluate the analgesic efficacy of TAP block and ITH in upper-abdominal surgeries

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was defined as the incidence of moderate-to-severe pain during movement within 24 h (hr) postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: This retrospective study employs a propensity score-matching (PSM) design

Number_Analysed.evidence: Among the 182 patients analyzed after PSM

Result_Outcome.evidence: patients in the ITH group presented a lower incidence of moderate-to-severe pain on movement at 24 h after surgery (TAP vs. ITH, 44.0% vs. 27.5%; p = 0.02)

Harms.evidence: Pruritus within the first 24 h after surgery occurred more frequently in the ITH group (TAP vs. ITH, 6.6% vs. 29.7%; p < 0.001)
